meanings.sent1: The children were frenzied with joy when they saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent2: The frenzied crowd pushed forward to catch a glimpse of the celebrity.
meanings.sent3: The frenzied puppy chased its tail in circles, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The frenzied storm tore through the town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: Her frenzied dance moves on the stage captivated the audience.

meanings.definition: Characterized by intense activity or agitation
meanings.sent1: The frenzied squirrel darted from tree to tree, searching for nuts.
meanings.sent2: The frenzied pace of the city never seemed to slow down.
meanings.sent3: The frenzied alarm clock rang loudly, startling him awake.
meanings.sent4: The frenzied market was bustling with shoppers and vendors.
meanings.sent5: His frenzied typing on the keyboard showed his urgency to finish the report.

meanings.sent1: The frenzied fans cheered loudly for their favorite team.
meanings.sent2: Her frenzied speech inspired everyone in the audience.
meanings.sent3: The frenzied artist painted with such passion and creativity.
meanings.sent4: The frenzied protest march echoed through the streets.
meanings.sent5: His frenzied guitar solo electrified the entire concert hall.
